The Rivers and Beacon-hills of Gondor

wikitext.*:
'''LEP''' is a [[Common Eldarin]]<!-- We usually write "Primitive Quendian", but since the source spec. says "Common Eldarin", I've used that (User:Morgan) --> [[Sundocarme|root]] signifying "finger",<ref name=VT42>{{VT|42b}}, pp. 24-26</ref> or "pick (up, out) with the fingers".<ref name=VT47>{{VT|47a}}, p. 24</ref>

==Derivatives==

*[[Common Eldarin]]: ''leper-''<ref name=VT47/>
**[[Quenya]]: ''lepta-'' ("finger, feel with fingertips"); ''leper''<ref name=VT47/>
**[[Telerin]]: ''lepta-'' ("finger, feel with fingertips"); ''leper''<ref name=VT47/>
**[[Sindarin]]: ''leber''<ref name=VT47/>

*Quenya: ''[[lempe]]''<ref name=VT42/><ref name=VT47/>
*Telerin ''[[lepen]]''<ref name=VT42/><ref name=VT47/>
*Sindarin ''[[leben]]''<ref name=VT42/><ref name=VT47/>

==Other versions==

In the manuscript "Words, Phrases and Passages in ''The Lord of the Rings''" (late 1950, early 1960s) appears the root LEPEN (or LENEP), yielding the derivatives Quenya ''[[lempe]]'' and Sindarin ''[[leben]]''.<ref>{{PE|17}}, pp. 95-6, 160 (roots appearing as "√LEPEN or LENEP")</ref>

In the ''[[The Etymologies|Etymologies]]'' (ca. [[1937]]) appears the root LEP-, LEPET signifying "finger", yielding the derivatives Quenya ''lepse'', [[Noldorin]] ''lhebed''. The extended forms LEPEN, LEPEK, signifying "five", yield Quenya ''[[lempe]]'', Quenya ''lemnar'' ("week"), and Noldorin ''[[lheben]]'', Noldorin ''lhevnar'' ("week").<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 368</ref><ref>{{VT|45a}}, p. 27</ref><ref name=VT48/>

In the ''Gnomish Lexicon'' (ca. [[1917]]) appears the root ''lef-'', yielding the derivatives [[Qenya]] ''[[lemin|lempe]]'' and [[Gnomish]] ''[[Elf (Gnomish)|elf]]''.<ref name=VT48>{{VT|48a}}, p. 20 (note 17)</ref><ref name=PE11>{{PE|11}}, p. 53 (root appearing as ("√''lef-''")</ref>

In the ''Qenya Lexicon'' (ca. [[1915]]) appears the root LEPE, with the derivative [[Qenya]] ''let'' ("finger").<ref>{{PE|12}}</ref>

{{references}}
